column4: virtualbox-ose is installed, how can i start it?  it is NOT under apps>sys tools
it's in applications, accessories now
I wouldn't go so far.. we've only just met.. =)
yes.. I think it was moved for 8.10
hmm.. ok.. have you installed the kernel module for it?
try running it from a terminal.. see what kind of error messages you get
what did you run to start it?
did you reboot after you installed virtualbox?
I think you need to reboot to make the kernel module load properly
its a printer with a usb 'dongle' for bluetooth
what is CUPS?

whats happening
not a lot.. trying to wind down before going to bed.. don't know if irc is winding me down though.. =)
run whilst you still can
hehe
before you go, i installed an hp printer yesterday...and the directory for it is on the desktop.  how can i move it?
the directory for it ?? your printer has a directory? I don't quite understand
well its a folder on the desktop called hplip-2.8.12 which contains many, MANY files and folders.  (its like program files in windows)
oh.. you've compiled something?
i followed this.. http://hplipopensource.com/hplip-web/install/install/index.html
I think it might have copied the needed files to other places in your system when you used the make install command.. try changing the name of the folder and see if you still can use the printer
ok thanks
